content: st yo first and last sts of round and weave in ends pull up a loop video right-handed / left-handed yo pull through 2 loops on hook 2 times single_crochet yo draw through 3 loops on hook insert hook into designated st yo and pull up a loop bl yo pull through 2 loops on hook when instructed to work into the back loops only fpsc insert hook only under the back loop without hook insert hook from front-to-back-to-front around post going under front loop each stitch is formed as usual so post is in front of hook yo and pull up a loop picot yo pull through 2 loops on hook complete st as indicated chain 3 insert hook in front 2 half_double_crochet loops of first chain yo insert hook into st yo pull up a loop yo pull through all loops on the hook yo pull through 3 loops on hook hbhdc fphdc yo insert hook into designated stitch yo insert hook from front-to-back-to front around yo pull through stitch and first loop on hook post so post is in front of hook yo pull up a loop yo draw through both loops on hook yo pull through 3 loops on hook hbdc double_crochet yo insert hook into designated stitch yo insert hook into st yo pull up a loop yo pull through stitch and first loop on hook yo pull through 2 loops on hook 2 times yo pull through 1 loop only making a chain st fpdc yo and pull through both loops on hook yo insert hook from front-to-back-to-front around puff post so post is in front of hook yo pull up a loop yo insert hook into designated st yo pull up a long yo pull through 2 loops on hook 2 times loop treble_crochet yo insert hook into same st yo pull up a long loop 2 yo 2 times insert hook into designated st times yo pull up a loop yo pull through 2 loops 3 times yo pull through all 7 loops on hook madux james square a yarn of serendipity copyright © 2023 page 2 of 14 symbol guide asterisks * to repeat instructions after a single asterisk as directed example *single_crochet in chain-1 space chain 1 skip next half_double_crochet single_crochet in next chain-1 space chain 1 skip next fpdc repeat from * around parentheses indicates a group of sts that are worked together in or around the same st i also use parentheses to indicate the name of sts skipped example #1 2 double_crochet chain 2 2 double_crochet in chain-2 space example #2 skip next 2 half_double_crochet chain-1 space 2 half_double_crochet brackets repeat instructions within brackets as directed example double_crochet chain 1 double_crochet in next double_crochet chain 1 skip treble_crochet 2 times count totals total chain spaces are included in the st count corner chain spaces are not included in the total example counts 48 double_crochet 36 fptr 8 chain-2 space 4 chain-2 corner space 100 total/25 per side
